p: Red blood cells (RBC) are elevated in approximately 50% of HSE cases [ 10]. The differential diagnoses for an elevated RBC include a traumatic tap or subarachnoidal hemorrhage. In the case of a traumatic tap, corrections should be made for the protein and cell counts [ 10]. Although more complicated formulae adjusting for anemia and peripheral leukocytosis are available online at http://reference.medscape.com/calculator/csf-protein-concentration-correction, a simplified way to correct for the influence of a traumatic tap is to subtract one white blood cell for every 700 RBC/mm 3 and 1.1 mg/dL protein for every 1000 RBC/mm 3 [ 35, 36].
